title: Pines of Rome, Fountains of Rome, La mer [ALAC, m4a]
description:
Fritz Reiner conducting the Chicago Symphony Orchestra through Claude Debussy's impressionist masterpiece, "La mer," and two parts of Ottorino Respighi's so-called Roman Trilogy: "The Fountains of Rome" and "The Pines of Rome." Recorded in October 1959 ("Fountains" and "Pines") and February 1960, these are some of the first pieces to utilize that exciting new technology -- stereophonic sound.

This rip is from the 1995 BMG release of RCA Victor CD 09026-68079-2. The original recordings have also been re-mastered and released on a Hybrid SACD, this is NOT the source for these files. They are encoded using the Apple Lossless codec, in .m4a containers. These files are iPod-ready; you may need to re-encode them for use with other digital players.
